                   IT Service Desk   24 hours a day, 7 days a week     In NYC: 1-212-998-3333  AskITS@nyu.edu   Contact form   ServiceLink         In-person help in NYC   10 Astor Place, 4th Floor  9:00am-6:00pm, Mon-Fri       Global locations  See the "How to get help" section to the left for local Service Desk information.          related pages            NYURoam Wireless       NYU Classes       NYU Google Apps (Email, Calendar & more)       NYU ResNet       NYU Print Service       NYUHome Help       ITS Training & Workshops       IT Service Status                     The IT Service Desk is the first point of contact for technology services and help from Information Technology Services; see below for contact details.   For self-service support and request forms for services provided by ITS and an ever-expanding number of other NYU-provided services, explore NYU ServiceLink .       New York, Accra, Madrid & Tel Aviv   NYU community members in New York, Accra, Madrid, and  Tel Aviv can contact the IT Service Desk in a number of ways:    For help by telephone , call 1-212-998-3333 to speak with IT Service Desk staff 24 hours a day, seven days a week. (NYU-NY community members can simply call 8-3333 from on-campus phones.)    For help online , submit your question (including as many details as possible) using the contact form or by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu . A representative will respond to the email address you supply within one business day.    For in-person help in New York , visit the IT Service Desk at 10 Astor Place, 4th floor, from Monday through Friday, 9am to 6pm ET. For help with configuring your laptop computer, however, call 1-212-998-3333 first to make an appointment.     Abu Dhabi   NYU community members at NYU Abu Dhabi can contact the IT Service Desk 24 hours a day, seven days a week by sending email to nyuad.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 971-2-628-8888 (or simply 8-8888 from on-campus phones).   NYU Abu Dhabi Campus Technology Center walk-in hours on the 3rd floor of the Library are: Sunday-Thursday, 8am-7pm GST; Friday: closed; Saturday: 12pm-7pm GST.   Berlin   NYU community members at NYU Berlin can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 49-30-290291-333 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones).   Buenos Aires   NYU community members at NYU Buenos Aires can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 4828-5233 (or simply 833 from on-campus phones).   Florence   NYU community members at NYU Florence can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 39-055-5007-777 (or simply 0-7777 from on-campus phones).   London   NYU community members at NYU London can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to nyul.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 44-20-79073-333 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones). NYU London IT Service Desk hours are Monday through Thursday, 8am to midnight GMT; Friday, 1pm to midnight GMT; and Saturday & Sunday, 5pm to midnight GMT.   Paris   NYU community members at NYU Paris can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 01-53-73-28-33 (or 3-2833 from on-campus phones).   Prague   NYU community members at NYU Prague can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 224-240-882.   Shanghai   NYU community members at NYU Shanghai can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to shanghai.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 9-5555 (from on-campus phones) or 86-21-20595555 (from off-campus phones).   Singapore   NYU community members at Tisch Asia (Singapore) can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 800-181-1101 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones).   Sydney   NYU community members at NYU Sydney can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 61-2-8016-8233 (or 6-8233 from on-campus phones).   Washington, DC   NYU community members at NYU Washington, DC can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 202-654-8333 (or 504-8333 from on-campus phones).    For NYU telephone, voice mail, and telecommunications support, please visit the   Telephones & Voice Mail page.    Faculty looking for technical support with academic projects should contact the   Digital Studio .    Page last reviewed: January 27, 2015

Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                          ITS is NYU's central organization for technology-based     services, including computer, telephone, Internet services,     and much more. ITS connects people to people, to their work     and studies, and to the information, training, and technical     resources they need to achieve their goals.               Nepal Earthquake Disaster Email Scams (Alert)   In the aftermath of the devastating earthquake in Nepal, just like major disasters before it, human nature is often at its best, but for some, it is at its worst. Following major disasters, scammers usually send out floods of email in an attempt to either solicit donations for fake charities, or else to lure users into clicking links containing malware or responding to phishing attempts. NYU encourages users to take the measures to protect themselves; click the "More" link for detailed recommendations. | More      Recent ITS News and Alerts        New Articles on a New Connect      Nominate a Student for a $500 NYU IT Computing Prize      A Note On Illegal Downloading           Recent Computer Security Alerts        Nepal Earthquake Disaster Email Scams (Alert)      Microsoft Security Vulnerabilities      TA15-051A: Lenovo Superfish Adware Vulnerable to HTTPS Spoofing           » All News and Alerts                                       About ITS                              Get Connected                               Communicate & Collaborate                               Help & Support                                 Computer Security                               Instruction & Research                               Locations & Facilities                                                           ITS Quick Links         Connect: IT at NYU        IT Service Catalog        ITS Policies & Guidance        Mobile Device Support         NetID and password        NYURoam Wireless        NYU Calendar        NYU Classes        NYU Email        NYU Google Apps        NYU Start page         Remote Instruction Support         ResNet         ServiceLink        Training & workshops                                Notices & Alerts        IT Service Status        ITS News & Security Alerts        NYU Info Alert Page        BobCat                             NYU IT Resources        NYUHome        Main NYU Site        NYU Libraries        NYU Computer Store        NYU Mobile App        Digital Communications        Law IT Services        Stern IT Services                                Ask ITS      ITS is here to help! Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                                 About ITS                              Get Connected                               Communicate & Collaborate                                Help & Support                               IT Service Desk                      ServiceLink knowledge base                      Training & Workshops                          Request & Account Forms                          IT Service Status                          Administrative Systems Support                          Departmental Desktop Support                          ITS Publications                                                   Computer Security                               Instruction & Research                               Locations & Facilities                                                                         Home           //         Help & Support                                                  ITS Help & Support                         search the site                                                                        related pages            ServiceLink       Administrative Systems Support       Departmental Desktop Support       ITS Training & Workshops        Computer Purchasing Recommendations                           Individual Computer Support    Desktop Computer Support for NYU Departments    ITS SUDS: Keep Your NYU Computer Clean!     Systems Administration Services      Administrative Systems Support      Computer Purchasing Resources & Recommendations      Individual Computer Support   ITS provides individual computer support to NYU faculty, staff, administrators, and students in degree or diploma programs by phone, email, online, in person, and through training and workshops . Browse this website for information about the many services ITS offers; or search the ServiceLink knowledge base .   If you can't find the information you need, submit your question via ServiceLink or, in New York, call the IT Service Desk at 212-998-3333, open 24x7x365 (click here for contact information at NYU's global sites ).    Desktop Computer Support for NYU Departments   ITS Client Services also offers enhanced on-site and telephone support services to NYU departments through our Desktop Support subscription service. Faculty and staff from subscribing departments can contact ITS Desktop Support Services through a dedicated phone number and email address. For more information, see the Departmental Desktop Support page.    ITS SUDS: Keep Your Work Computer Clean!   ITS SUDS (Security Updates Delivery & Support) is an ITS subscription service for Windows computers combining automated delivery and installation of Symantec AntiVirus updates, related proactive anti-virus protection and support, and automatic download and installation of applicable critical operating system fixes and Windows security patches released by Microsoft. This helps ensure a high level of protection for SUDS-enrolled computers. For more information, see the Departmental Desktop Support page.    Systems Administration Services   ITS offers systems administration services, actively manages and maintains a continually increasing number of Local Area Network (LAN)-based departmental and school file servers—currently over 80 servers for more than 35 academic and administrative departments—and provides system support for the more than 4,000 desktop computers attached to these servers. ITS Communications & Computing Services provides consultation to many departments with LANs that are not directly supported by this service. For more information, contact the IT Service Desk at 212-998-3333 or via the Ask ITS form.     Administrative Systems Support   ITS provides application development and support for NYU's core business systems, and IT helpdesk services for the NYU community members who use them. For more information on these and additional related services, see the   Administrative Systems Support page.     Computer Purchasing Resources & Recommendations   NYU's Information Technology Services works in conjunction with the   NYU Computer Store  and NYU Purchasing Services' NYU Computer Purchase Program to provide resources for NYU staff and administrators looking to purchase one or more new computers. See the Computer Purchasing Resources & Recommendations page for more information about  this program, and for additional information for NYU students.    Page last reviewed: July 28, 2014
